div.l: He looketh vp and doıı̄un til he hath founde
The Clerkys hors ther as it stood I bounde
Behynde the mylle / vndir the levesssell
And to the hors he goth / faire and well
He stripeth of the bridell / ryht a noon
And whan̄ the hors was loos he bigynneth to gon̄
Toward the fen / ther wylde marys renne
And forth wᵗyth wyhe / thoruh thykke and thynne
The miller͗e goth a geyn̄ / no woord he said
But doth his note / and wᵗyth the clerkys pleyde
Tyl her corne was wel and faire I grounde
And whanne the mele was sakked / and wel y bounde
This Iohn goth out / and fonde his ww hors a way
And gan to crye harrawe and welaway
Our hors is lost Aleyn / for cokkys bonys
Step on thi feet com of man at onys
Allas our wardeyn̄ / has his palfrey lorn̄
This Aleyn̄ al forget / both mele and corne
Al was out of mynde / his husbondry
At whiche gate / is he gan / he gan to crye
The wyf cam lepyng / Inward at a ren̄
She seyd allas / your hors goth to the fen̄
Wyth wylde marys / as fast as he may go
Vnthank com on his hondys that bond hem so
And he that bettyr / shulde haue knytt the reyne
Allas ꝙquod Iohn / Aleyn̄ for goddys peyne
Ley doıı̄un thi swerde / and I wol myn̄ alswa
I ys as swyft god wot / as is a ra
By cokkys hert he sal nat skape vs bathe
Why ne hadde thou put / the capul in the lathe
